title: Stock Funds Slump 6.2% So Far in ’22
sub_head: After starting the year strong, U.S.-stock funds slumped for the first quarter, and bond funds did no better
body:
Stocks finally gave in.
After holding up relatively well during the pandemic and lockdowns, the stock market weakened in the first three months of 2022—making for a poor quarter on average for U.S.-stock mutual funds and exchange-traded funds.
